main_definition: The quality of being intellectually or aesthetically outstanding, inspiring admiration or awe.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Extremely beautiful and awe-inspiring; grand in appearance
meanings_and_examples.example: The view from the mountaintop was sublime, with snow-capped peaks stretching as far as the eye could see.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to or arousing profound admiration and awe; majestic
meanings_and_examples.example: The sunset over the ocean created a sublime scene that left everyone speechless.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Surpassingly noble, admirable or excellent in quality or style
meanings_and_examples.example: Her writing had a sublime elegance and depth that captivated readers around the world.
The athlete's performance was so sublime, it seemed almost superhuman.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to a supreme or divine nature, often with religious connotations
meanings_and_examples.example: In many cultures, the concept of God is described as being incredibly sublime and omnipotent.
